author: mattmann
msg: - cache copies of ConditionInstance per WorkflowProcessorThread so we don't instantiate them each time that we check
if conditions are satisifed for a TaskInstance to run

author: mattmann
msg: - major change to the way that WorkflowTasks and WorkflowConditions work
- now there is the notion of a TaskInstance and a ConditionInstance as separate
entities from their actual WorkflowTasks and WorkflowCondition counterparts. The WorkflowTask
and WorkflowConditions are no longer interfaces, they are concrete classes that
store metadata about the WorkflowTaskInstance and WorkflowConditionInstances respectively. This
way, the actual implementers of the WorkflowTaskInstance and WorkflowConditionInstance interfaces need
not care what the taskId or conditionId, or taskName, or conditionName are. These are considered seperate,
system-level metadata that does not need to concern the implementers of the conditions and tasks.
